content.description: Oyster Run is an odd Franken-route immediately right of Sunshine on a Dark Day. It starts off with slabby climbing up a zig-zag crack system with sparse trad gear (5.8 PG), then switches abruptly to steep crimping with frequent bolts (10a). If you want the fun crimping but not the spicy lower section, either start on the cracks of Dark Day and step right to the bolts or rig a top rope. The anchor for Sunshine and Shadow is well located for toproping Oyster Run, bring some slings to reach over the lip.
content.location: Follow the approach to Sunshine on a Dark Day, which is the prominent corner system. From the base , Oyster Run is about 10' to the right (large flat boulder) and wanders up to a zig-zag overlap and onward. Bolts on upper section are hard to see because they start about 40 feet up.

content.description:
This is an awesome climb up the right side of the Main Wall, with excellent exposure. 3 mostly bolted pitches lead to the top.

P1 (5.7, 60ft, 5 bolts) - Start on the belay ledge and head up on good holds, staying in a corner. Route leads a bit towards the left to a sloping ledge with the anchor. You can place a .5 before the chains.

P1 (5.10a, 40ft, 4 bolts) - Begin with a short lieback below the roof, then sidepull/tension your way right. The crux comes at the second bolt and is very well protected. Finish on 5.8 blocky climbing to the anchor on a small ledge.

P3 (5.8, 80ft, 5 bolts) - An exposed and thought-provoking pitch. Start up some hollow flakes with good holds past 3 bolts. Place a few pieces and clip a couple bolts up and left through the crack/overhang/horizontal chimney. After pulling onto the headstall continue up 15 feet of 5.7 to the anchors.

Descent: 60m rope minimum. One double rope rappel or 2 single rope rappels.
content.protection:
6 quickdraws

Pro to 2"

Bolted anchors with rap rings

60m Rope (2 single rope raps to get off)
content.location:
Back up in Gruesome Gully.  Has a nice belay platform just below and left of Gotta Keep Dancin.

Can get there by traversing right on the ledges below Snag Buttress or follow the trail from Pigeon Stool Wall.  There is a blank Sign hanging from a tree marking the turn to go up Gruesome Gully.

content.description:
Gotta Keep Dancin is a fun 4 pitch route that goes up the far right side of the Main Wall.  But the pitches are short and can easily be linked into two.  The rock is good, but there is a chance of some random loose rock.

P1: 5.9 40' 5 Bolts  Go up a dirt ramp left to the wall. Traverse left and up to clip the first bolt.  A short overhang corner system leads to the anchors

P2: 5.8 35' 4 Bolts  Continue up the same crack system to the anchors, shares a ledge with a fir tree.

P3: 5.7 50' 3 Bolts  Step left onto the arete. Go up into the crack system which kind of feels like a low angle chimney higher up.

P4: 5.7 35' 4 Bolts  Short slab climb leads to the anchors.

Descent: Either 2 single rope rappels or 1 double rope rappel.
content.protection:
Gear to 2"

Quickdraws

Slings/Runners

Bolted anchors w/ Rap Rings
content.location: The right most route on Main Wall East. Route goes up the left side of Gruesome Gully, which divides the Main Wall From Pigeon Stool Wall.

content.description: Route that sees minimal traffic, after pulling the crux to get off the deck follow your own adventure is various terrain from gully to very low angle slab in the terrain that lies to the right of the "SUNSHINE AND SHADOW" Bolt line.
content.protection: First bolt shared with SUNSHINE AND SHADOW and a fixed piton can be clipped a few feet past bolt. Afterwards plenty of PRO opportunities with standard rack. BOLTS with Chains up top.
content.location: Same start as SUNSHINE and SHADOW about 50 feet to the right and slightly uphill from "SUNSHINE ON A DARK DAY"

climbs.name: Dancin' with the Divine (aka the Dallas Kloke Memorial Route)
climbs.fa: Established by Calvin Landrus and Jim Thompson, FFA pitch 1 Calvin Landrus, FFA pitch 2 Tyler Thompson

content.description:
PITCH 1: Climb the first pitch of Lord of the Dance (5.7) or Dance with Ticks (5.10c/d)

PITCH 2: From belay, move left up crack placing gear, move into overhanging corner with three bolts. Short pitch 40'. (5.10c)

PITCH 3: Climb corners and slab with two bolts to broken overhanging crack with two bolts. Continue up and left in crack. Reach over and clip one bolt from the crack and then fire the crux (5.11c). 30 feet of exposured 5.10 climbing pass three more bolts. 90' pitch.
content.protection: Mainly bolts with occasional gear placements (cams from 0.4" to 3").
content.location: Main Wall East. One can come in from the top of Mt. Erie and rappel the route.

content.description: Gently overhanging and fairly sustained after an easier start. Blocky climbing through the first three bolts quickly kicks back and the pump is on! Shares a bolted anchor with the first pitch of Lord of the Dance.
content.protection:
7 bolts.

Pro to 2'' suggested in guidebook.
content.location: The bolted line between the bolt lines of Sunshine and Shadow (5.8) and Lord of the Dance. The first bolt is a good 15' from the ground.

content.description:
Not to be confused with Sunshine on a Dark Day to the left, this route starts in a shadowy corner then follows a slabby arete. Worth checking out.

It's steep and cruxy off the ground and the first bolt is 15' up. Your pick: plug in a finger size cam, stick clip, or fire it off! Follow bolts left onto the slabby arete. The last 30' is an easy runout to chains where you can rap off with single 60.
content.location: Left side of Gruesome Gully, about 100' right of the lower right edge of Snag Buttress (Laus Deo/Sunshine OADD area). Starts in a shady corner with black rock.
